tape_source.implementation: Homepage script array rendered into tape DOM; not sourced from frameworks.json or a dedicated endpoint.
evidence: Live page contains hardcoded update records in script block (e.g. Feb 10-14 entries).
No public /api/daily-signals endpoint detected on live site during crawl.

data_sync_status.summary: frameworks.json is internally structured and timestamped, but source alignment to AGENTS_2026_SOURCES.md is incomplete.
checks: framework evidence URLs are a smaller subset and include URL variants not matching markdown catalog exactly.

confidence_integrity.summary: Confidence labels are present at index and dimension levels, but one-to-one confidence-to-source traceability is not consistently enforced at claim granularity.
checks: AMI/ARI/EPI confidence labels present in frameworks.json.
Not every confidence label maps to a normalized source ID list in the public payload.

automation_status.summary: Daily signals appear manually embedded in frontend code and updated by deployment, not via automated ingestion pipeline.

issues.description: Live tape is hardcoded; no API-backed feed or timestamped ingestion process.
issues.impact: Limits update cadence and creates stale-signal risk.

issues.description: No normalized source ID model shared across frameworks.json, tape updates, and report claims.
issues.impact: Confidence labels are harder to audit and automate.

issues.description: Evidence URLs in frameworks.json do not fully align with AGENTS_2026_SOURCES.md source inventory.
issues.impact: Potential citation drift and mismatch across surfaces.

issues.description: robots/sitemap responses from live crawl were inconsistent and returned not-found in probe attempts.
Homepage signals are month-scoped and edition-weighted, with weak daily freshness cues.
